documents.document: "Our aim is that the WHO Hub will take this work to the next level, generating better data and better analytics for better decision-making and a safer world."-@DrTedros https://t.co/kNEO9GzkMC

"Indeed, it was the EIOS [Epidemic Intelligence from Open Sources] system that picked up the first reports of a new virus in Wuhan, China, in the early hours of 31 December 2019."-@DrTedros https://t.co/miBoXhonuD

"It builds on WHOs existing work through the @WHOGOARN and the Epidemic Intelligence from Open Sources initiative, which scans online news sources for reports of public health threats."-@DrTedros https://t.co/kNEO9GzkMC
"The WHO Hub will be part of the WHO Health Emergencies Programme, and we expect it to play a vital role in the global health security ecosystem."-@DrTedros

"Hosted in Berlin, the WHO Hub will be a global centre that works with partners around the world to lead innovations in pandemic and epidemic intelligence, data, surveillance and analytics."-@DrTedros

"Modern technologies give us unprecedented tools for collecting, analysing and disseminating data in real time around the world. Thats what the WHO Hub for Pandemic and Epidemic Intelligence aims to do."-@DrTedros
"Viruses move fast, but data can move even faster. With the right information, countries and communities can stay one step of an emerging risk, and save lives."-@DrTedros

"The #COVID19 pandemic has exposed gaps in the global systems for pandemic and epidemic intelligence. And its a fact of nature that there will more viruses will emerge with the potential of sparking epidemics or pandemics."-@DrTedros

"As Minister @jensspahn said, rapid and reliable information is essential in every area of health, but especially when it comes to preparing for, detecting and responding to epidemics and pandemics."-@DrTedros
"And were very grateful for #Germanys financial support for the WHO Hub, and for hosting it in Berlin, where it will benefit from being in an innovative environment."-@DrTedros

"Thank you so much, Minister @jensspahn, and please accept my deep personal appreciation for everything you have done over the past few years, and especially during the past difficult 12 months."-@DrTedros
"@jensspahn, thank you so much once again for your leadership and partnership. You have the floor."-@DrTedros https://t.co/9MmrNnIvDK

"Of course, like every great leader, Chancellor Merkel is supported by a great team. Even as he has led the response to #COVID19 at home, #Germanys Federal Minister of Health, @jensspahn , has played an essential leadership role on the global stage."-@DrTedros
"Once again, my deep gratitude to Chancellor Merkel for her leadership and partnership."-@DrTedros

"In October last year I was honoured to speak to Chancellor Merkel, which is when we first discussed the idea for a new centre that would serve as a global platform to enhance global capacity for pandemic and epidemic intelligence."-@DrTedros
"As part of #Germanys G20 presidency, Chancellor Merkel also initiated the first ever meeting of #G20 health ministers, which included a health emergency simulation exercise."-@DrTedros

"In my first week as Director-General in 2017, I had the honour of attending the #G20 Summit in Hamburg, where under Chancellor Merkels leadership, #Germany put a very strong emphasis on health and emergency preparedness, years before #COVID19."-@DrTedros

"#Germany has been a steadfast partner to WHO for many years, but especially during the past year. And I have personally appreciated the strong leadership of Her Excellency Angela Merkel, the Chancellor of Germany."-@DrTedros
